metadata.title: CVE-2017-14136 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
OpenCV (Open Source Computer Vision Library) 3.3 has an out-of-bounds writeerror in the function FillColorRow1 in utils.cpp when reading an image fileby using cv::imread. NOTE: this vulnerability exists because of anincomplete fix for CVE-2017-12597.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-14136` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libcv2.4 - 2.4.8+dfsg1-2ubuntu1.1
libcvaux2.4 - 2.4.8+dfsg1-2ubuntu1.1
libhighgui2.4 - 2.4.8+dfsg1-2ubuntu1.1
libopencv-calib3d2.4 - 2.4.8+dfsg1-2ubuntu1.1
libopencv-contrib2.4 - 2.4.8+dfsg1-2ubuntu1.1
libopencv-core2.4 - 2.4.8+dfsg1-2ubuntu1.1
libopencv-features2d2.4 - 2.4.8+dfsg1-2ubuntu1.1
libopencv-flann2.4 - 2.4.8+dfsg1-2ubuntu1.1
libopencv-gpu2.4 - 2.4.8+dfsg1-2ubuntu1.1
libopencv-highgui2.4 - 2.4.8+dfsg1-2ubuntu1.1
libopencv-imgproc2.4 - 2.4.8+dfsg1-2ubuntu1.1
libopencv-legacy2.4 - 2.4.8+dfsg1-2ubuntu1.1
libopencv-ml2.4 - 2.4.8+dfsg1-2ubuntu1.1
libopencv-objdetect2.4 - 2.4.8+dfsg1-2ubuntu1.1
libopencv-ocl2.4 - 2.4.8+dfsg1-2ubuntu1.1
libopencv-photo2.4 - 2.4.8+dfsg1-2ubuntu1.1
libopencv-stitching2.4 - 2.4.8+dfsg1-2ubuntu1.1
libopencv-superres2.4 - 2.4.8+dfsg1-2ubuntu1.1
libopencv-ts2.4 - 2.4.8+dfsg1-2ubuntu1.1
libopencv-video2.4 - 2.4.8+dfsg1-2ubuntu1.1
libopencv-videostab2.4 - 2.4.8+dfsg1-2ubuntu1.1
libopencv2.4-java - 2.4.8+dfsg1-2ubuntu1.1
libopencv2.4-jni - 2.4.8+dfsg1-2ubuntu1.1
opencv-data - 2.4.8+dfsg1-2ubuntu1.1
python-opencv - 2.4.8+dfsg1-2ubuntu1.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: opencv package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.4.8+dfsg1-2ubuntu1.1').
